reviews.review_msg: Great prof! Don't know why there's so many bad reviews..Her notes explain everything and she clarifies any questions at the end..couldn't ask for any better

The examples Srabana covered in class were challenging...definitely hard to follow. This course is very difficult overall and to pass you need to practice practice practice. I use textbooks as a guide for all my courses except this one - reading the slides is enough. Focus on the calculation questions. Toughest course I've taken by far.

She seems to care but overall shes just not that good at teaching.  She makes constant mistakes while doing examples and does not explain things really well.  Would recommend taking the class with someone else
Srabana means well but doesn't convey the material well. She goes way too fast, her notes are useless, and her lectures are extremely boring. I'd recommend taking this class with another professor.
Horrible prof, she goes way to fast in class, her notes aren't helpful, and she expects her TA's to answer all questions.

I had him as a TA. I attended the first two classes before I cstopped. When you ask him a question, he gives you a blank stare that says "how can you not know this". If I knew, why am I taking this course? I'd spend 2 hours in other TA's office instead of going to one hour of his tutorial and feeling like a dumbass. He's RUDE and ARROGANT.
No lecture note other than the one by his hand writing, and his hand writing is terrible. Explanation is really hard to understand.
Horrible prof, tanked my gpa b/c of this class. marking is unreasonable and notes are useless. basically gotta teach yourself the course
Dont take it with matadeen!!!!!!! Material was super dry plus exams were incredibly hard and unbelievable. Everyone did so bad and it was a gpa killer. AVOID
Omg dont take bus 207 with this prof! Cant explain anything and is a gpa killer. U WILL FAIL like only a few ppl manage to do okay in this course. Dont take it with this prof
Omg guys dont take bus 207 with him!! His finals r so bad oh god! take it with someone else for sure. You will fail his class, he doesnt scale, so hard exams, ITS A DISASTER
GPA KILLER! final exam is very tough and assignments are not related to the textbook.   theory questions and T or F are quite difficult
Easy course, if you are good at math 0.0  just take the notes, do the assignment questions, and think for a little bit. Believe it or not, I got full mark on his final.

His classes are fun, he jokes all the time and makes it easier to undertsand. However, I recommned to take this class with a different professor, he is not helpful at all and his final is so hard, it is not related to any of the assignments you do, it will bring your GPA down!
Dont take his class! Absolute not recommended.. take it with a different professor if possible, gpa killer

This professor does not go over any practice questions relevant to the homework, leading you to seek resources outside of class to complete assignments. The slides don't tend to be very relevant either, and the professor does a lot of talking but not explaining.

4th year student retaking 207 with Mohamad here. Ignore the bad reviews from salty 2nd years. Mohamad explains concepts a LOT better than other profs - he tells you what you need to know & why. First midterm was very similar to the practice Q's. Gives out bonus marks like candy and makes this difficult class somewhat easy. Nice guy. Take him.

Lectures and explanations are very unclear and the slides are not helpful at all. He doesn't do a good job of explaining even simple concepts. He also comes off like he doesn't care about the students and is too good to give effort to answer your questions. Grading is based 100% on exams. Be prepared to learn everything yourself if you take him.

His exams have like 10 questions lol if you get one multiple choice wrong thats like -10 marks. You also have to explain your multiple choice answer thats worth half the marks. Lectures are useless he just makes dad jokes about how his wife hates him. Only time i enjoyed the lecture is one time when he made fun of himself for being bald.

Be ready to teach everything yourself because the lectures and lecture slides are not helpful for preparing for exams. The grading was based 100% on exams but he also assigns weekly assignments. If you do them, you get nothing. If you don't do them, you lose 3% of your entire grade for each missing assignment with no late submissions. Bad prof.
Awful class! The professor is always late, only uses 2 hours of lecture in a 3-hour class, and cant even teach. Be prepared to learn everything on your own, this is a very hard class!

Lectures and explanations are very unclear and the slides are not helpful at all. He doesn't do a good job of explaining even simple concepts. Be prepared to learn everything yourself if you take him.

I think the reason of a lot of people wanna give him a bad rating is because the material in course is already hard enough, which cant be avoided no matter who is teaching you. I do think Allan is good, no textbook required, just come to his class and make notes of what he said and focus on weekly assignments which are similar to exams

Do not take this course with this professor. The material is already difficult and his teaching style makes the course exponentially more difficult. The first half of the semester was a lot harder than the second half. Midterm and final exam questions were nothing like the assignment questions. Weekly assignments require a lot of effort.
Probably the worst prof I've had at SFU. Avoid at all costs. Tests are nothing like assignments, lectures are impossible to follow because he talks so slow.

Allan is a good guy and is funny. Pretty mediocre teacher, he gets the material across okay but nothing special. His TAs were quite annoying though, never replying to emails and creating confusion right before exams which did not help the stress level. Assignments and exam questions were also marked extremely hard.

Not sure how he does in-person but 100% would not recommend taking his online class. He obviously has a hard time adapting to the new technology and still using the same evaluation/grading/teaching method even when EVERYTHING is different. Probably the most unorganized and irresponsible exam experience I ever had...
absolute snail at giving lectures. A snooze fest, on god. No feed back on the assignments. Please, don't take this mans class.
He is very slow during lectures. His assignments are very lengthy and very different than what he teaches in class.
If you have another choice, dont choose him.

It's 1 hour and 12 mins past the time to start the final exam online during this pandemic and this unicorn still has not figured out how to use technology! This alien is hilarious. But he is also a sneaky prof -- Expect midterm and final questions that come from left field. Still waiting!

Professor is such a boomer that he doesn't utilize PowerPoint slides at all. Everything is in person and nothing is online. When you submit for weekly homework, you have to show up in person to submit. Big unlucky for those that take a 8:30AM class with him. Lectures are 3 hours and are as dry as the desert without water. TEXTBOOK MANDATORY.

For the midterm, we are given 2 hours. The class is 3 hours long. The midterm is as long as finals for some class and we are given 3 hours for those. Literally 95% of the class was there till the end because the test was too long. And all notes are by paper no lecture slides which make focusing on the lecture so hard for 3 hours. Teacher is stuck
This teacher is the ABSOLUTE worst teacher I've taken in my 3 years post-graduate career.
The teacher is stuck in the prehistoric age dry class and even drier teaching style.

This course was the most confusing course I've taken at SFU, not because of the content because of Allan and his unorthodox teaching methods. He does not use nor post any lecture slides and you have to write everything down whilst in class, imagine writing for 3 hours straight. His notes are scattered overall don't take him take anyone else!!!!!!!!

Yo would love this class if you get close to him. BUS 207 depeneds on calculas. it taks time, but in general, loved Allan and my exerince with him, looking forward to take BUS 478 as soon as he ofered the course.

This was the most unreasonable course I've ever taken. I went to both the TA and profs office hours, redid his assignments a billion times, and spent an entire week studying for the final. The prof is condescending when you ask him questions, and I genuinelly feel that he takes pleasure in seeing students fail. Not qualified to teach.

Allan is by far the best prof ever! Take 207 with him only! He has a simple approach, come to class, focus for 3 hrs, go home do the assignments, and you'll be fine. No pre-readings, no quizzes. All assignments are practice questions. and his exams are based off assignments. I wish other classes were like this. pay attention to his notes.

When you walk into Allan's class, you do not realize the journey you are about to undergo. Upon entering the arena, Allan's warm and welcoming nature provides an air of comfort that makes students feel at home. He presents economics in a way that will make you laugh, learn, and cry tears of joy. A remarkable man, the very best beedie has to offer.

Overall, He was a alright professor who teaches you to understand the material. But when it comes to the exams, the questions are similar to the assignments, but more harder and trickier to solve. I did not buy a textbook and just used my friends. The assignments and notes are the only things you should focus on when studying for exams.

I wish I would have done better but thats on me. This is an amazing professor. He is great at teaching and he's hilarious. If you do your assignments on your own you will not have any issues with the midterm nor the final. All I will say is: if you do as he says, you'll succeed.

I have zero respect for this bald guy. He does very minimal to provide secondary sources to help his students learn. If you go to his lectures, he will go at a fast pace and not allow his students to write down the materials. The worst part is that there are no lecture slides or notes. So, this class tests you on the things he says and thats it.

IF YOU ARE READING THIS PLEASE AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS. This guy actually does not teach. He puts in zero effort in this class and doesn't have any lecture slides or any secondary sources we can refer off of. Basically, he expects us to memorize every thing that comes out of his mouth. This guy is one of the most arrogant professors I have ever had.

Class attendance in necessary as he does handwritten notes; his style of notes are very sporadic so when you are reviewing for exams it's difficult to understand what is going on. The textbook was only necessary for assignment questions but not necessarily for course content.

teaches you to understand material, not to memorize it. If you like logic and math (leaning more towards finance) you'll probably love this class. Textbook use is minimal, only for a few easy questions on the homework. if you wanna save money split a textbook between you and a few friends. Use his notes and assignments to study.

Surprisingly ended up being one of my favorite business professors as he makes a dry course more interesting with anecdotes and comedy. The only complaint I would have is that some of his in-class examples do not apply to the weekly assignments leaving you to figure it out by yourself or go to a TA, who aren't very helpful.

Homework average is super darn high, and averages for exams are usually low. Follow his advice and do the assignments over and over again. Don't bother reading from the textbook, his T/F or MC questions come from stuff he mentions in lectures that he doesn't necessarily get you to write down. Funny guy, not as bad as everyone makes him to be.

I scored very poorly on the midterm, but worked very hard to prep for the final exam - redoing assignments and understanding concepts and passing the course. Allan is a great personality but the course is very demanding. Attend EVERY lecture!
Best instructor EVER!! Finally a real teacher who has a fantastic sense of humour.

The way Allan thought this course was useless. The whole course is just based on solving direct questions and not much of understanding. The assignments were fine, but the final was very different from what he thought us. It seems like he just took an old final exam and gave it to us.

The final was insanely difficult in comparison to the midterm. Kind of a trap since the midterm was "just like the assignments". Enjoyed his lectures, but most of the question on final was very different from assignments.

Blink in class? You'll get lost in the assignments. Rely on homework answer keys from last term? Expect a failing midterm. Believe in Alan when he says the final will just be like the assignments? Get ready to stare into nothingness and wonder where everything started going downhill during the exam. ;)

Mislead the entire class regarding the content of the final exam. I studied the assignments and practice midterm for weeks, and for absolutely no reason. I have no idea why he would do something like that.
All I can say is that I have so much respect for the people who'll get an A in this class.
The final was extremely hard. Not from the assignments. It was all theory based way too hard. I've never written such a hard final.

This class throws me right back to Math 157. I did well on assignments, and on the midterm, but just wrote his final and it was absolutely the hardest exam I've ever written. It was a complete curve ball and he did not prepare us whatsoever. It was composed of questions he never showed us before. What an awful class, and Allan is mediocre at best.

Was enjoying this class up until the final. Lectures were semi-enjoyable and I was able to get an above average grade on the midterm(which was very similar to the assignments/practice exams). Professor told the class that the final would be similar to the assignments, but it wasn't even close. Spent multiple days studying for nothing.
Blatantly lied about what would be on the final. Said that it would be the same as assignments and practice exams but it wasn't even close. Don't take it with him.

Allan is a great prof. You need to attend all his lectures to take notes and the homework is really important cuz they contain very similar questions showed in mt and final. Just focus on lectures and do exercises you will get desired grade.

Go to class, write down everything he says. If you're decent at math, the course is pretty straight forward. The assignments and exams are essentially the same in terms of difficulty and material. Make sure you do every assignment by yourself as much as you can. The lectures and exams are 90% related, ignore reviews that state otherwise.

Honestly, Allan is by far the WORST professor ive ever had. SFU PLEASE hire profs who actually teach course material that will be on the exams so that I am able to actually have a chance at succeeding in the course. Do yourself as well as your GPA a huge favour and DO NOT take 207 with Allan.

His assignments are challenging (even the TAs did not know how to do some of the questions). Lectures are dry, but you need the notes for the exams. Midterm and final were fair and mostly math based. Professor Matadeen seems to be condescending at times when students asked questions in class.   Take this course if you are good at math!
A good professor in total. Assignments and simple midterm are very important, so try to do and understand all of them.

If you are having a hard time to fall asleep at night, have no fear because Allan can make you fall asleep instantly. I was never at any point in class interested at what he had to say. However, the midterm and exam are very fair if you manage to stay awake and listen to him. MAKE SURE YOU DO ALL THE ASSIGNMENT FOR THE Midterm. His jokes are sexist

This class I feel asleep in the first 10 minutes, you have to right all of his notes dwon by hand. His jokes are not funny at times sexist. However his exams and assigmnets are all fair if you understand them up and down you will get above average.
Others are fine, but in his final there will be some questions that are super tricky and unexpected. Be sure to review his in class note.

He is a nice professor, explains his lectures well and keeps it interesting with random jokes. When I took Bus 207 with him all our notes were taken by hand and no online notes were posted, so skipping class was not an option. The midterm and final were based on assignment questions, so if you did poorly on those make sure to see him or the TA.

His tests and exams are not too difficult. His lectures are sometimes interesting. The only big problem is that he is not helpful or willing to help his students. Also the textbook is only for doing assignment.
The course is difficult. Matadeen does not seem interested in helping students who come to his office hours.

Finally a prof that doesn't surprise you on exams. Just like he said, if you can do the homework, you can do the exams. He has an extremely dry humour and keeps the class laughing at all times. The midterm was so straight forward, but the final was definitely more challenging. If you want someone who preaches "you see what you get" he's the man.

This class is really hard but the professor is great.  You really have to take the time to understanding the lecture notes as well as the assignments and examples.  The final exam is not at all impossible like people say.  I studied really hard for one day and got 75%.  However, if you are not good at math I would suggest another professor.

I believe he is a good and experienced instructor. Makes a lot of jokes to keep audience interested, and assigns fair amount of homework. Always listen to what he's emphasizing on the lecture and do your homework on your own! Be an honest student, then you will find his class very rewarding!

This prof thinks he's funny, when he's not. Very rude, and when students ask questions, he answers them as if you should have already known. His exams and final are extremely hard, and his assignments are easy, overall bad prof, avoid at all costs
Best.......... hha because I got A. He give us opportunity to get good mark even thought you fail in the midterm or assignment. TO be honest the course is hard but the prof is nice.
I would say midterm is like assignments. Final is a mission impossible as he said. Basically, worst professor ever and he always think he is funny LOL

I really don't understand anyone who likes Allan's class. Allan is a funny guy, but funny does not equal easy or fun in anyway. This course is brutal and as someone mentioned previously: good luck learning the concepts outside of lecture. If you didn't understand it in lecture you probably won't ever understand it. Take BUS 207 with another prof.

Assignments were fair; tricky sometimes, but the TA's were extremely helpful so it was ok. The midterm was like assignments, final wasn't related at all. He's funny but condescending when you ask a question in class. The textbook was  useless for studying, but necessary for assignments. Attending lecture is mandatory for a good grade.
Avoid him at all costs; assignments are easy, but the tests aren't. Your GPA will fall.

A very nice prof makes you laugh in the class all the time.His final is hard even though he tells its not,if you do the weekly assingment you will do well in the mid term and can aim for a good grade.
Great prof. Notes are little mass. So do not skip the cls. You will enjoy it !
Humorous guy. Great lecture! The examples from real life is very helpful and interesting.

Before I took 207, I'd heard rumors that Allan was a GPA killer.    But I decided to stay in his class after the first lecture. What a humorous guy! Believe it or not, I got full mark in his final. Allan could be a GPA booster, if u get all his jokes in class.
Do not skip his lectures! He is good, but this course is hard. I guess the average mark of final exam is no more than 60. Thank goodness it is curved, and I get an A-.

Allan is a funny guy. He's one of the few teachers that can make you laugh, learn and enjoy his class at the same time. You can skip his classes, but I advise not to. What he teaches in class will make your life very very easy when doing the assignments, because of his clear explanation and well-organized notes. If he's teaching, take his course!

One of the few profs that can keep your attention for 3 hours. Good teacher, but lack of online notes, little use of the textbook, and no tutorial made this class exceptionally hard. If you didn't learn it in lecture, good luck learning it outside of class. Try and take it with another prof, if possible.

I know many students don't like him, but please you need to know that this this prof demands much less than other 207 prof (no need to read the textbook and do any extra questions). All you need to do is attending every class and sitting in the first row and taking all the notes, and doing and understanding your homework by yourself, u'd get an A

He is one of the worst professor I have ever been taught by and it doesn't help that his handwriting is ineligible. Plus his notes go all over the place plus if you have your tutorial with him, he will try to bully you if you don't know the right answer. His exams are super hard and the assignments are easy. My advice is avoid THIS GUY AT ALL COSTS

If you're not a math whiz like myself, I would consider taking this course with another prof. His teaching style is very concise. He moves fast. Half the notes in class were pretty much useless towards the exams/homework-the only helpful class notes were the examples. Exams are pretty much the assignment questions-but it's not as easy as it sounds.

allan is a funny guy, he has a very clear clarification, just do all the assignments and truly understand his notes, life would be much easier. Overall, i don't agree the criticism about him. He has a really good understanding and experiance for teaching this course!

This prof told us on the first day that he fails 18% of the class automatically.  I did not understand the class material at all but after some help from a tutor it all started to make sense.  Didn't use the text at all, except for a few assignment questions.  Attendance is pretty much mandatory because he doesn't post slides or lecture notes.

Great Prof. All his lectures + tutorials are VERY informative, make sure you attend both. Allan is a very funny guy, his lectures go by fast but his examples are very clear. Downside: material is a bit hard. Upside: the average is pretty low, so if you get above average (usually 30-40s) you'll do fine because the class is curved.

a lot of jokes in lectures. very interesting. He is nice, but never ask questions which has been tought in tutorial in his office hour. I never use my textbook, his notes is specific. all assignments are very important!! do it carefully.

Matadeen is a god. If you take good notes in lecture and do the assignments on your own (as he specifies several times), you will do perfectly fine. You won't need to read the ridiculously expensive textbook unless you want more clarification on graphs, terms, etc. He's awesomely witty and makes a point of burning groups of people in every lecture.

He's the first prof to ever be so vocal about losing his hair so don't irritate him about his balding.  He also gets jealous of people with hair that's better than his...guess he's just going through a mid life crisis.

This professor comes off as disrespectful. He often mocks the Arts program. History majors are also insulted by stating that students are better off not attending university at all. Matadeen lacks imagination and passion. Don't take classes with him if you're an Arts major. Moreover, he goes over material much too fast and isn't all that clear.

anyone realize that the 2 comments below are pretty much the same but worded abit differentley? I wonder who might of wrote such a comment?(matadeen obviously). this class is GPA KILLER, avoid him at all costs

Not my favourite prof but this man really knows the staff he presents in lectures....clear and well organized. Dont have to study a lot, but make sure u truly understand all assignments and notes. My MD is just above average, but my final is better. I got A in the end. I think if u show the improvement in final, he would give u bonus.
The course is........ Midterm is fair but final reallyreally hard!

I hate economics, I hate math, I thought I would hate this class... But I loved it, all thanks to this man. He's wisecracks kept me laughing, his accent was fabulous -- my friends and I have a Matadeen dictionary ay-vel-lay-bel ;)
Awesome prof with a smug attitude, great wisecracks, and a cool accent.  This course tests your ability to understand (rather than to memorize) the implications of economic concepts.
To be fair, he teaches the course but not exceptionally well. If you're in his tutorial BE WARE!  He'll walk around harassing everybody and acting like a pompous jerk.

His lecture notes are clear and easy to understand. But this only covers up the real difficulties of this course. His assignments are on a completely different level. I know some profs don't want you to just spit out what they talk about during lecture but the questions he puts on his assignments are nearly impossible to do.
Good Teacher. Very informarmative. Can anyone tell me if his assigments come from the textbook? Dont want to buy text. Much appreciated
He can teach, but this course is still really hard!  Assignments were alright, but MT was hard... & FINAL was VERY HARD.

If u take his class, u better do ALL his assignments.  And if u don't understand them, go to him for help cuz he's very helpful. His notes pretty much explain everything. The MT was alrite but watch out for the final, it was freakin hard.

he's cool and humorous but really serious with teaching. the key to get a good mark is that you should do all the assinments BY YOURSELF!!!more importatly, you should really know why you do those questions that way!!!his notes is really clear, no needs to read textbook unless he mentions. overall, highly recommended.
No Comments
The majority of his lectures are on concepts, he doesn't go over examples very often. If your good at math and calculus you'll do fine. If not, get help from your TA!!

Allan's notes are quite clear, and as the term went on he did more assignment-type questions. Tutorials helped in completing upcoming and correcting past assignments. After killing us on the midterm, the final consisted of questions VERY similar to the notes/assignments. If you understand the assignments, you should do relatively well on the exams.
he is good
Very Clear Prof, go to his class and do the assignments yourself you should get an A

Midterm is similar to the samples. The final exam had a couple of odd questions but was overall very doable. To do well in this course you must read over and understand his lecture notes & know how to do the assignments & why certain operations are being performed. He's very approachable so ask him questions if you don't get the material.

The class is hard in general but Allan does a very good job explaining the material. He makes everything very clear and easy to understand. Be sure to spend a lot of time doing the homework and practice questions to prepare for exams because they are quite tough. And you don't want to miss ANY of his lectures! Recommend taking 207 with him!
All right, I guess. A lecture can be a bit tedious, however.

Allan is the best prof I've ever had!!! He knows the stuff, and makes everything very clear. If you go to the lecture, and do all the assignments by YOURSELF, you'll do really well ;) Oh, but his exams are little tough though. BUT, again, if you do the assignments, it won't be any problem!

He is a pretty cool guy, gives very interesting lectures, just do the assignment but don't do them 365 times, if u get it, u get it, if u don't, go get help. If you do well in Math 157 and Econ 103 you'll ace this course, i got A+ in math 157 and econ 105, and i got the same for this course. Good prof

A clear speaking teacher!  His words are slow and easy to catch!  Do all assignments and redo them not just for tutorial marks, but for doing well on the exam as the exam questions are fairly similar to the ones assigned.  Oh ..... and u'll just love his accents ("AvaiLAble" = "AvEIlible") LoL!
I can totally see the favourism going on in the classroom if he was a high-school teacher.
Cool prof, and he is funny too.haha! it's not a hard course if u take it seriously. Do the assignments by urself and understand them, you will be more than just fine...=)
No Comments

Notes are straight forward but you have to put more effort into just what he gives in class with assignments ....and tends to be nice to students he likes and hates you with a passion if he doesn't like you....T/F is tricky

Go to the lectures and do the assignments by YOURSELF. The book is useless, exam q's come right out of the notes. exams are tough b/c of the true and false so do perfect on the written (which isnt hard if you have done the assignments and corrected your mistakes) and u will do fine in the class

While the course content isn't easy - the professor is very good. He shows interest in the subject and cracks little jokes to keep it entertaining.  The key is you HAVE to do the assignments and sample exams. He is available for help - very approachable- and will give extensions if you need them! Plus he is pretty hot (like a brown george clooney!)
He is the best prof ever!
Very mean and condescending....acts nice in front of everybody but enjoys putting people down...should really be reported for degrading comments he makes to students

This guy is quite the character. Go to lecture and tutorials always. He isnt very helpful so always see the TA's (Paul is very good). MT isnt bad, but the final is hard. In the 2nd half of the course he expects to you miraculously learn things that arnt in lectures or the text so see the TA. Do the assignments BY YOURSELF & memorize each question.

If you never looked at him during lecture you would think it was an automated voice recording.  Basically you should swallow as much as you can and puke it out when its time.  Somewhere within the chunks should be the right answer BUT just hope the right ones didn't go out the other end.  ABC soup anyone?

clear lectures and notes, but long super challenging exams.. the exams r like very different from what we have learned.. you can never think what he thinks.  Not helpful in assignments, go find ur TA..

He sometimes give insults to students who answer wrong or ask things that he assumes we already know. He's, however, very clear on his lectures and everything appears in assignments and exams are from what he teaches in class-- his in class examples are really useful. Textbook isn't useful; follow his lectures.

Bus 207 with Matadeen is not a fun class. He makes occational jokes which are amusing, but anyone that actually pays attention to how he acts can see that he is not interested in how well students are doing. He will only help you if you need clarification. If you work on a problem for 5 hours and dont understand it he will not help you.

Who says 207 is a hard course? I totally do not think so. If you did good on math 157 and econ 103, you will ace this course. Prof is very informative and sometimes he makes fun in the lecture. 8 30 in the morning, but no choice you guys since he is the only one teaching this course. I dont know why he does this in the morthing tho. it was so painf

He is a very good professor and he makes lots of jokes in class.  All his lectures were clear and concise.  Final is definately more difficult than the midterm even though he says people do better on the final.  He could some what of an ass at times.
No Comments
No Comments

he is a good teacher but not a nice guy, if u r chinese student,man bless u,cuz he is not very nice to chinese. one of my friend asked him a question he said:" u should go back to kindergarten!" unbelieveablly mean and rude!
Enjoyable class. If you are a serious student, you'll find this course very rewarding. Plus it's really not that hard to get a great mark. All depends on your attitude!

His teaching is clear, assignments are hard, exams are also hard because of the T&F qs (VERY tricky)...don't worry you'll get used to his type of questions by the 3rd assignment. Never miss a lecture, even the last one...
very very interesting and clear lectures. this course isn't easy so go to ALL lectures and tutorials. read materials and do assignments on your own. BE PREPARED! Really nice guy though!

Allan is a very good prof. No wonder he's been teaching this course for so long. You MUST attend all lectures and do ALL asst's on your own. This course is challenging but in a good way. It was much better than what I expected from ex-students comments.

The course itself is not that hard if you are good at math. He is funny, ie. lots of jokes in Lec. For this course, attanding Lec. and doing the assignment on your own are the necessary conditions for getting a good grade. If you do a bit of the readings, no problem of ending up within A rang.
Tricky class. Take the lower assignment marks in exchange for doing them by yourself. In turn, you'll do better on the midterm and final

Great instructor. His exams are easy. The final was tricky, I guess... but the tools that you need are what you have already learned from your assignments. Do all the assignments ALONE and you'll be fine.
Oh boy! He's not such a great prof!!!His marking is unfair and his exams are hard (especially the final)! I wonder if i can still rely on this website after how many good comments he got!!
Though it is the second week of this semester, I am already tired of his pace of teach ---- way slow. Please dont let me get to sleep.... Mr. Matadeen.....

Wonderful prof. Loved his sense of humor. Course is hard, but he made it fun. He's sarcastic but he really wants you to learn; won't give you the answer just like that, you have to learn on your own, but he's willing to help you. Do as many practice q's you can get your hands on.
best econ/bus prof ever!!! Lecture and notes are great, but final is abit hard.

allan is a great teacher.  the material's tough, but much more manageable with the new book.  he was never poor before, but the new text makes him and the course quite a bit better.  wouldn't have anyone else teach it.  there's a reason why it's always him.
Nice prof, midterm was o.k but finals was relatively easy, make sure you do all his assignments before final and it will be ezzzzy

He is a good prof, clear and funny jokes too, though the course content isn't that easy and he really enforce the rule of failing the last 20% of student. other than that, this is a must course for Business student anyways.
great prof! awesome jokes! he is very clear and thorough when he teaches. you'd totally understand what he's explaining. assign and exams are fine, not hard at all.

I think he is a good teacher. Too bad that 10% of the class MUST fail. Overall I do not think it is a hard course. Keep up with the readings and do ALL your assignments...by yourself! I did enjoy a lot his sense of humor. I know some people do not like him but I just love him!!
Good class, funny teacher, great teacher. The notes are continually coming during class, but as long as you read the text, you'll do perfectly fine. And yes, the tests are tricky
One of the best profs i've ever had. Explains everything clearly. He's quite demanding but he makes the course interesting. Interesting attitude.

He is absolutely the worst prof I've ever had. He has terrible attitude, no interest in lecturing, and no idea how to teach. Avoid this course and take ECON 301 instead. You will get a much more thorough understanding of economics and a much higher grade.

best prof ever! I'm not doing that good in this course, but Allan is just a very good prof. His way of teaching is excellent, very clear and have good jokes. I wish I can take another course with him.

Great Prof!
 Very interesting lectures even though it is at 830 in the morning and 2hrs long. Fair exams and straight forward if you did the homework.
 
 Awsome accent, Movado watch (Bling!), funny jokes, but the text is kind of useless.
Great teacher
his teaching is kinda of clear and assigments are okey. Final and midterm are all the things we learnt in the lecture. not really difficult

T.a.l.k.s l.i.k.e A. R.o.b.o.t. Good prof though. Homework assigns were okay, but final, damn near cried at the difference, plus the fact it was only 2 hrs instead of 3 (which he didn't mention until 5 mins before). And it's pronounced a-vay-LAH-bull  NOT   a-vay-LAY-bull

He's a very very good prof.  He teaches very clear and after attending each lectures, you sort of have the lecture content in your mind.  When you go home and study for it, it's just like reviewing stuffs... Just go to all of his lectures and do all the homeworks ALONE (as suggested) and you'll fine
awesome prof
Awesome prof.  Sure he's strict but it makes the class fair for everyone.  He's clear and prepared in his lectures.  His smartass jokes are hilarious... Enjoyed this course very much
It's bad enough the course material itself is hard, his exams don't make it any easier! Bad Bad Bad
Interesting course...Prof is pretty kool..and helpful clear lectures.....hard course but you gotta work for it..notin comes easy

His in-class teaching is crystal clear. His notes are helpful, and he's funny as well. He's very helpful during his office hours. But his exams are ridicilous, as they really ask about your understanding on the class.
His midterm was alright, but the final was brutal...way harder than any practice problems. Overall a really tough course and prof.
Trying to match up the lecture material to the textbook was like a 300 lb man slipping into a thong. It just doesn't fit.
He's a good teacher. The material can be difficult, but he explains it very well. Lecture and notes are useful. Exam are fair, questions based on homework.
no teaching ability
He is tough...But he almost teaches every semester... so no choice...
Midterm is OK, Final is really hard.  Over all, pretty good teacher.

This guy is crazy. Incosiderate, and tries hard to act funny. His favorite phrase is "if your uncle dies..on the exam". I wish it was his uncle that dies on the day of the exam. Wonder if he would be here to watch over us...
notes are clear, but rarely came in handy... final was extremely hard.

fair marker and fairly good lecturer.  people complain about the hard midterm and finals but it all gets scaled anyways so why does it matter?  what matters is that you separate the smart from the challenged, which is what his class does.
An excellent prof.  Take really good notes and put 100% into the class and you will come out with a good grade. Don't buy the text!
No Comments
Legend! Bad attitude but amazing teaching skills! Exams are tough but I would love to take class with him again
unfortunatley there has been a lot of talk about sexism which is why he still as yet deos not have tenure. If you are lookig for someone fair - avoid at all costs
he is nice to only young girls. otherwise he's an ****. he required totally useless textbook, and u have to copy his notes that are only useful to build your grade.
Midterm was alright, final exam was brutally hard.... I was left scratching my head and ended up with a not so nice grade :(
Just try to survive the final.  That's all I can say.  Just try to survive...

Excellent Professor, he teaches real well if you actually pay attention.  Just difficult material.  Tests are kinda tricky but you'll get plenty of practice.  Don't need to buy the txtbook, I've read all the readings and often its not related
His Exams are out of this world. Don't bother buying the book you'll NEVER use it!
He hates cellphone ring during the lecture.
No Comments
Easy to understand lectures, but bad prof cuz he's not helpful at all!
The man's a legend. Apart from being sexy, he's funny as well. On the bad side his tests are real hard to do well in
No Comments
he is the best prof EVER!dont freak out when u see the midterm;) FINAL just a peice of cake:Ohe is fair & u learn soooooo much in his lectures. Dont u ever miss his lectures.He is simply the Best!

he is sure a tuff prof to have, but just remember to listen to what he says carefully in lectures, attend all tutorials and memorize his assignments and lecture notes before an exam, and u r going to be okie guarenteed.
 
 i got a B+ by just doing that
IF people living in Canda can't speak English that's their problem... He's a great TEACHER
he picks on students, but sure can teach
doesn't care about his students just does things the way he always has...
He needs to let loose!!
they should take this angry little man out of the class room before he explodes!
a bitter little man
He is an awesome teacher.  He explains things very clearly and is available for help.  I would recommend him!

This guy is the worst prof ever....he picks on ppl and only cares about the ladies....the funny thing is that he drives a BMW...that's  for young ppl...not an old guy like him.....his accents....on man.....only aliens would understand him...
Best Prof ever!
difficult to understand his accent. makes an easy subject difficult.
No Comments
he is sneaky, and hv no sense of fairness.
His exam are hard, but that is the only way to seperate the A+ from the A, right? I like his ego-ness.  The best thing is that he can and willing to teach!
This guy sucks.  He thinks he's better than other people.  Does not help people if they have questions.  Avoid at all cost!  Not funny at all.
Got the highest mark in the midterm.  Ends up failing the Final!  Final is a killer!
Remember to turn off your cell phone,... or prepare to die!

Extremely hard prof.  Expects you to know everything inside out, even if minor.  Homework takes on average 5+ hours to complete in one week, even though less than 5 questions.  Exams brutally hard.  Even if know homework inside out, can still fail final.

His attitude made coming to tutorials very uncomfortable. I made up for that by going to a different tutorial time. The lectures were delivered well but the droning voice is hypnotic and can put one to sleep.
huge ego... but he can back it up.  Fair
nice prof., but with a lot of ego though.can teach.assigments are demanding, but didn't really helped on the exams.needs a lot work.
unfair!  Assignments are not the same as exam.  Not helpful at all.
very good prof.
As someone else said  Completely unhelpful. Self centred and egocentric  Condescending, too.
excellent teacher
Tough classs, but awesome prof!
No Comments
No Comments
Completely unhelpful.  Self centred and egocentric
Good professor.  Really understands his material
WAY TOO HARD
Ok midterm but the final was very tricky
great prof! very organized and clear..know everything from his notes! no text!
just try to understand all his notes and don't even bother buying the textbook
No Comments
Bad attitude to students and missing student's assignments
No Comments
Very intelligent, Class is challenging though.  Don't mess with him!
No Comments
Go to class,  he doesn't use the book...
Good teacher, funny, don't get on his bad side
No Comments
He is not nice, but he IS funny.
HE IS NOT NICE
Don't skip his classes!
No Comments
Very easy midterm, tricky final.  Overall, the course is pretty easy
He is a nice guy. He always encourages us to ask questions. Plus he is quick to respond to any question asked.
He is not a good choice for this course, choose another instructor to instead of his section!

He does a flipped-classroom approach, half lecture half mini-presentations that aren't difficult if you've payed attention in the Macro/Microecon prerequisites. No text book required as he provides great notes. One of the best courses I've taken at SFU. Learned a lot of interesting theory that was relevant to the real world, with little to no math.

I'm a 4th year student, this is my first "C-" marking is very subjective, questions on exams are based on articles he gives. There are weekly group assignments worth 30% of your grade and your grade gets re distributed based on what marks your team members assign you. Makes you answer Q's in front of class, just awful, rather have the calculus.
Worst class of my undergrad. Not very clear and he doesnt answer questions very well. The TA's are not there to help (only has markers), and the class requires pure memorization of his notes.

Good news: No calculus Bad news: class is so hard you will be begging for calculus MT averages 50% or below, he is incredibly difficult to understand and his tests much much harder than his practice questions. Confrontational when you ask questions (doesn't even consider your point of view) I would rather suffer through calculus than this, its bad
use all real life cases for students to apply theories. Make sure to do the assignments and in-class practices, the exams will be a piece of cake. NO MATH

Great professor; understands the course material extremely well and knows how to convey it. His office hours are highly recommended for any confusing questions. Largest drawback is his flipped classroom approach where learning is largely done at home and questions are mainly done at school. If you're fine with that, definitely take him.
such an amazing class with Mark. no calculus whatsoever. discussion based lectures and exams similar to assignments and in-class practices. REALLY RECOMMEND bus 207 with Mark.

I'd say the course content is the most difficult to get your head around, and he's not a bad prof, that is to say he doesn't do anything unsuspected and he's fair.   Don't buy the textbook - just study his lecture slides and practice properly identifying the economic theory behind the articles and you'll do fine.

Mark is awesome. He teaches the material very well and extra accessible to answering questions. Speaks fast so get ready to write. Slides and class notes super helpful, did not buy textbook at all. Zero calculus. Understand all his material, do homework questions and be good at writing. Aced it.

Gives a fresh take on 207 - majority of questions are article questions with very little math, uses flipped classroom. He's a really tough marker but if you put in the work you should do well. Would highly recommend if you are interested in economics as it's a lot of work but very engaging and informative. Very willing to help and answer questions.

He is very helpful when you ask him for help. His lectures are boring, some may sleep however this course if an eye opening to the read world. He grabs articles and makes questions based on it.  The first midterm average was 45% however it is curved.

Awesome prof, makes econ truly enjoyable. Speaks quite fast, but notes are super comprehensive. Zero maths for this course = great! Read & highlight notes before lecture strongly recommended. Do all assignments by yourself before discussing in your group. Fair exam.

Worst pro ever.  Speaking very fast and boring.  He can continually speak 3hours just give u 10min break .  So many people fall asleep in his class.  I strongly suggest don't take this course especially if English is ur second language.

Mark is a great professor. He is among the most intelligent professors I've encountered at SFU. He is very knowledgeable and gives plenty of real life examples. You will benefit from attending lecture. Mark is, however, a tough marker. Exams are lengthy. If you do his weekly assignments and practice you will know what to expect on exams.

He's awesome! such a nice guy! he teaches so well, and is very helpful, u can tell he cares about the students, his exams were so similar to assignments, do them all and u will have no prob. his final was harder than the MT but nothing surprising enjoyed his class solely bc he was teaching it. def recommended, uses no calculus so made 207 a breeze!

Mark is SUPER NICE, CLEAR, HELPFUL, always willing to answer q's! Econ was never my thing but his lectures made the material more interesting & easier to understand. Very clear lecture notes (super helpful for exam). No calculations on exams, only based on application of theories. Weekly assignments are kinda difficult and time-consuming, however.

Awesome teacher! Best I've ever had at SFU so far. The guy knows his stuff and is very helpful. He assignments are relevant to the material learned in class. I rec this teacher to everyone. I'm even looking to take other classes with him!

Excellent professor. The fact that he graduated with a PhD from Columbia showcases how brilliant he is. Not an easy course, like all 207. His notes are very clear, and he really helps you to understand the materials. Totally recommend him!
I think he's a good prof.  He knows how to teach.  Exams are ok, and I think marking is kinda fair.
No Comments
No Comments
Tries really hard to help, but class SUCKS. Avoid 207!
No Comments
No Comments

He definitely made the course much easier. I took the class with him in Summer 2024 and really enjoyed it! Just practice all the example and tutorial questions, and you'll be set to ace the course!
Make sure to listen carefully during his lectures—he gives plenty of hints for the exam questions!
Currently taking him. Seems nice, though lectures can get confusing. Expectations may also be confusing.

Karen recorded her lectures which I loved to use to go back on in preparation for the tests. She also provides plenty of example questions which if you master are all very similar to test questions. I enjoyed the class and thought she did a good job at presenting the material and not making it any harder than it needed to be. e
Lectures can be dry, but staying engaged pays off. Exams are key, so use Unstuck study and the textbook to prep. Grades rely heavily on the final, so come ready to perform.

Karen is a good teacher. with two midterms 25% and one final 50%, the exams were pretty straightforward and very similar to concepts we went over in class. I didn't buy the textbook although the extra practice questions would've been good. make sure to rewatch lecture recordings.

LISTEN TO THE LECTURE !! make sure to watch the lectures for the exams and midterm! she explains what to expect and as long as you do the example and tutorial questions you'll be fine. TA's were not the best. highly recommend her for BUS 207, but beware that your entire grade is based on 2 midterms and 1 final.
have fun with a final worth 75% of your grade. do not recommend.

Horrible professor. During winter break, I saw an F on my transcript. I did all the exams, got ~40% but she still failed me. Emailed her, and she was still unwilling to bump me to a D. Don't take her if you're like me. Horrible prof at Beedie.
She has a super monotone voice that makes her lectures a snoozefest. There are no assignments and you are solely graded on the 3 exams. Would not recommend
Half of the class is always falling asleep and she can't even bother making the class more engaging. We wrote a midterm and she added some extra questions she never taught in class
worst prof i have at sfu
A good professor. Explained everything clearly in the lectures. Just pay attention to every details and you will be fine.

Honestly the way she teaches thing is not correct, half the time her sketches and diagrams are her own rendition rather than following what most other lecturers, textbooks, etc use. She sets a bad example of how economics is taught/learned

Karen is one of the best profs out there. Her exams are super fair, taken straight from the weekly examples and lectures. For theory, just pay attention to EXACTLY what she says verbally in lectures as she does expect you to remember those details. But she makes the content really interesting and tells you exactly what you need to succeed. 10/10

Karen is a great professor that lectures well and is very experienced. Graded by 3 exams total, which have both theory and calculation questions. Some of the theory questions can sometimes be a bit tricky so make sure to pay attention to the lectures, but the calculation questions are very similar to the weekly problems and aren't too complex.

Karen is a fantastic lecturer, and her exams are extremely fair and mainly come from her lecture notes and the example questions she provides on Canvas. All her lectures were recorded and uploaded to Zoom, which is helpful, and she knows how to keep students engaged during class.

As someone who doesn't understand econ, Karen is great. All lectures are recorded and added to Canvas, so I would watch all her lectures at home slowly rather than go to lecture. She actually works through problems, which really helped me understand. Her TAs also do that at the end of class. Very fond of her teaching style as a struggling student.

Good prof. Straight forward and everything you expect from a business/commerce prof. 
Class content is a mf. The slides and notes she provides on canvas are great and everything you need to pass the exams well. Read the textbook regardless.
Karen is really sweet and explains the concepts. However, you are only graded by 3 exams: 2 midterms and 1 final

I enjoyed microeconomics and really enjoyed this class. It's micro mixed with derivatives but it's not too bad. Professor Ruckman was a great lecturer. She explained concepts very clearly and her examples were very relevant. The textbook was optional and she tests from her lectures. She tells you exactly what to expect and has very fair tests.

Karen is a solid choice for Bus 207. The class is content heavy and leans on one of the more difficult courses in Beedie. But she explains concepts clearly. One downside is the grading criteria is based on 2 midterms and a final worth 50%. The exams are fair and similar to her lecture examples.

Karen was a great prof for 207. She's caring, has a sense of humour and really sets her students up for success by providing all the materials needed for the exams. Do all of the practice questions and memorize what she mentions in the recorded lectures and you will succeed!

No assignments, or opportunity to bring mark up other than 2 midterms (worth 25% each) , and final (worth 50%). The prof is nice but I learned most of the course concepts trough youtube tutorials rather than the lecture recordings. 207 is a generally difficult course.

Signed up for a course that was supposed to be fully in-person, she sends an email to half the class the day before it starts (I never received the email, had to find out from a fellow classmate) that she's switching to a "hybrid" model, meaning none of the lectures are in person, and instead are prerecorded online. Not the class I signed up for.

Karen is a great professor and really cares about her students. Don't bother purchasing the textbook, I didn't open it once! You need to attend lectures and memorize everything she says in her recorded lectures. Stay on top of it and you will have no problem succeeding. Test questions are extremely similar to weekly examples and tutorial problems!!

Karen's lectures are a little dry, as she was a theory heavy prof, which made me less interested in the content. The grading scheme of the class is insane, with 50% of your grade based on midterms and the other 50% on the final. Would not recommend Karen if you struggle with exams, as this grading scheme will screw you over. Not bad, but not great.

Karen is overrated. She's pretty average, I wouldn't say she's that good, but given that she's definitely the best option compared to others, I can't say she's that bad either. You can find better teachers on Youtube because she speaks quite fast and sometimes explanations aren't very clear.
teaches fluently and flawlessly, zero waste time, and doesn't ask ridiculous questions on exams

Karen is the BEST. Explains concepts SO well & makes what is said to be such a difficult course as simple as can be. Super cool, great sense of humor, very knowledgeable & genuinely wants to help you succeed. Took during COVID &was very impressed with its organization. Hope I can take more classes with her IRL. You won't regret taking it with her.
Incredible prof. I deeply regret not keeping up in her class, and my eventual poor grade reflected that; practice, do what she says, and it's an automatic B+ or higher

She's such a great professor. I loved having her, despite my natural distaste for math and economics. She made the concepts clear, and listening to her lecture recordings was super helpful, but you have to go to class too to take better notes and see what see writes in the projector.  She's really cool too, so go to her office hours if you can.

Really great professor overall.  She is very accessible outside of class and will take the time to help you.  Explains concepts well in lecture and goes through homework examples step by step.  Midterms and final were fair but tough.  Questions were all similar to the examples given in lecture.  Textbook is unnecessary to success in the course.

Karen is alright.  She does talk very fast and you really do need to listen to lectures over again to really understand the lectures.  That being said, I listened to lectures, studied hours on end, and still managed to fail the class.  Mind you, I'm terrible at economics but this is the first class I've ever failed.  It's very theory heavy.

This class is like microeconomics but on steroids and Karen is a great prof for this course. She explains concepts very thoroughly even though her voice is quite monotone. Be sure to go to lectures or listen to the lecture recordings as she can test things that were mentioned in lectures but not in the slides.

Karen is great! However, this class is curved and generally straightforward so to do well in this class: Read the lecture slides, RE-LISTEN to her lectures, and do tutorial/examples. Don't bother with the textbook, as her exams are purely off of lectures and practice questions. Also, focus on the theory as her exams are mainly qualitative. Goodluck

Karen is knowledgeable explains thoroughly but a little bit boring. Exams are straightforward from the lecture slides, memorize everything word-by-word. Do not worry about the calculations, focus on the theory and you will rock the class. No need for textbook

Bought the textbook but never used it. All you need to do is to study her slides and listen to the audio she records. Midterms are very straight forward if you understand the concepts.  I personally went to see her several times during her office hours. She was  helpful and explains very clearly although she barely has no facial expressions.

Straight forward class. 2 midterms 25% and a final 50%. Tests are all written and based on theory questions and calculations. Only complaint was the theory questions on the exam didn't get practised much in the weekly examples or tutorials.  Also these questions were usually ripped from one slide that she talked about in class.  Dont buy textbook!!

Karen is a good lecturer. All you need is go to class and take down what she says. Don't need to purchase or read the textbook. More qualitative than quantitative. Beware of the high class averages around 76%. 2 midterms, 1 final.

Karen's lecture notes and lectures are very clear and concise. You DO NOT need the textbook, all of her tests are based purely off her lecture notes. Re-listen to the audio recordings and you'll do fine.  P.S. The only Mathematics you need to remember is simple derivatives and simple algebra.

Everything on her exams is covered in her lectures. Lectures are recorded so you can re-listen outside of class. Listen to the lectures at least twice and you will learn everything you need to pass the exams, however you must attend class as she writes a lot of notes not included in the posted lecture slides, which are essential to understanding.
Good lecturer, very clear what she expects, all lecture slides/recordings online if you miss a class.

Karen is the BEST professor I've ever had. Her lectures are SUPER clear, she only tests what she talks about in lecture, and the harder concepts she will test using the exact examples she posed in class. Lectures aren't too long and she's just amazing. Can't say enough about her! If you're taking 207 do it with her!

She is absolutely amazing prof. My all time favourite. Her lecture are very clear and simple. Her TAs Adams and Garry are superb. Karen is very friendly and always willing to help and same goes for TAs. Loved the course and would love to take another class with Karen. She is awesome.
She is speaking so fast that you can't follow up. you should listen the recording after class that waste lots of time. I think the short answer is more difficult than calculated question.
I enjoyed the material and the teacher had a nice refined sense of humour. The TA's were really bad unfortunately and even she agreed that they were marking tests unnecessarily hard.
DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK!!!! Did not read a single word from it. Her lecture notes are everything you need and they are clear and detailed.

Karen is the best prof you can take BUS 207 with. She is excellent at explaining concepts during lecture, and has a really cool sense of humor. Very pretty with an amazing voice. 2 midterms (25% each, not cumulative) and 1 final (50%, cumulative). Focus more on the theoretical part. Exams are more than fair. Make use of the TA's office hours.

Karen is AMAZING. I hope to be able to have her again. Her lectures are FAST, she speaks quickly and covers a lot in each lecture without much time for questions. BUT if you do the reading she's easy to follow. Her exams only contain material covered in her lectures. She's organized and professional, dry sense of humour, approachable, very bright.

There's two midterms (not cumulative, 25% each) and one cumulative final worth 50%. All her lectures are recorded and posted online so MAKE SURE YOU USE THEM because a lot of the harder theoretical questions are from there. Some memorization but if you keep up each week you should be fine. I can't stress this one enough: go to the TA office hours!
Course: Fair theoretical and numerical  based midterms exams (2) and easy (1) final exam. Professor: Crystal clear, seriously cool sense of humour and attitude, ghost pepper on fire^10.
Super boring lectures
She is so helpful! try to make those material interesting . Attending the lecture for 2 hours and you can learn a lot of stuffs useful!!! she is the best!
Extremely boring lectures. Assigns excessive readings on certain weeks. Some midterm questions are extremely difficult (theory based). Would not recommend.

Karen is a very informative professor. Her lectures are clear (however she does tend to speak and write fast). Her tests are a mix of short answers and calculations. She is definitely a tough grader! You can do well in the class by listening to her lectures before your midterms and final (which is cumulative).

Good and clear explanation of concepts. Exams are fair, a little easy if you studied and attended class. ( I didn't but she records her lectures) Straightforward exams and if you do the practice questions you'll be fine. Textbook is useless, I downloaded the ebook but never used it. Good prof.

Karen is a great prof. Her Lectures are very informative and vital to doing well on the exam. She explains concepts very well and makes you interested in the subject. Exams are honestly totally fair, if not a little on the easy side for a class that has gotten a pretty bad reputation as far as easiness goes.

I don't know why people say that she isn't nice enough?! (Maybe they expect her to help them out through every step as if in high school).She was really nice and helpful to me and my friends during office hours and in class. She's super smart! 2 midterms and a final. You only need to understand her notes and the examples she gives weekly.

She is a great prof however she is extremely stuck up, she always looks mad 24/7. I could have received a better mark if not for her attitude that she shows during office hours which eventually made me stop asking questions. But aside from that, great prof great course!

Karen is probably the best prof you can take Bus 207 with. This course is very dense, there's a lot of info but she goes over everything very clearly. Midterms and final are very fair, she only tests you on the main concepts. Study off her lectures notes and recordings.

Karen is an overall great prof. She provides useful lectures but tends to speak really fast so listening to her recording before exams helps a lot. She does give off an impression that she doesn't care much for students, but in the end we're only here for the grade and there is no better 207 prof than Karen at SFU.

Karen is very knowledgeable and articulate. Covers SO much in each lecture. I didn't do as well in this class because it is less quantitative than I thought and very theory based. Didn't touch the text; her slides are JAM packed, but she tests only on main points and examples used in class. Fair exams, but gotta study hard.

I was extremely anxious about taking this class, but I am so glad I got it done with Ruckman as the prof. Although the course material isn't easy, she explains things extremely clearly and lectures are extremely informative. I didn't touch the textbook once so don't bother getting it. Study off her slides and relisten to lectures before the exams.
You won't find a better teacher to take this class with. Mid terms were both completely fair.
very clear, knows her stuff well. But, she seems quite rude and rarely responds to emails, and when she does they are very bland responses. Good prof, but doesn't care about students
Really knowledgeable, learned a lot in the class. Gotta work hard at it though, its tough stuff. Just fight through it and you'll get a lot out of it; good foundation for upper div courses!

Ruckman is a good prof who explains every concept clearly ... however she speaks quite fast because she has a lot to cover each lecture. However, she makes up for that by testing just the main ideas ... overall it was an excellent experience.
good prof. , u need to read the lecture notes only , no need for the book. subject itself is pretty hard but Karen makes it interesting

Content on exams is heavily based on lectures. Lectures can be interesting at times but for the most part are mild. Exams are straightforward and questions are fair and consist of short answer and calculation questions.

She is very accessible and approachable so if you do not understand a concept, just ask her to explain in during break or after class. Importantly, the tests are directly related to the practice problems she provides, so if you can do those, you are good to go. I did not understand all the concepts at first go, it was crucial that I asked her.

Bus207 is a tough course generally but Professor Peng delivers the contents very effectively. She tests on things she actually teaches and you will certainly do well if you pay attention to her lectures. Textbook is not a must, her slides are helpful enough and cover all the content.

She has one of the most innovative teaching styles out there. She breaks down the material into 5-20 minute sections so it is easier to focus on the concept being taught. The assignments and practice questions had thorough solutions which really help one learn the content.

Peng is an awesome prof! She tests on things she actually teaches so her exams are predictable and study-able. Complete weekly practice problems and you're halfway there. Her lectures serve as a supplement for her slides and are extremely helpful. She explains concepts well and is very approachable if you have any questions.
A warm and kind Person. Peng is the best professor I ever met at Beedie who really cares students learning. Explain concepts clearly and give helpful feedback if you really want to learn.

Peng was seriously the best prof for BUS207. Participation was an easy 20% basically given to help you pass the course. You do have to put in the work to study and do assignments. She even curved the final to help the majority of students pass. Great prof, clear explanations and stays after class to answer questions.

This course was difficult, but Pengs teaching style was very good. Every lecture we would work out a problem and then she would go over how to do it in great detail. This was very helpful in understanding how to apply the material learned in the pre-recorded lecture videos. She is very caring and will explain concepts if you reach out to her!
Don't listen to the haters. She's a good prof - BUS 207 is difficult regardless of prof, but she provides all the necessary resources. Exams are fair.

Peng is amazing, and the best prof I've had online. Shes so helpful and encouraging with questions, and structures her course very efficiently. Her exams are pretty tough and are marked pretty harshly, but if you practise the practice questions, lecture questions and re-watch the pre recorded videos before them, you should manage a decent grade.
Peng is simply a very, very terrible teacher. Save yourself and don't take her class.

Avoid Peng at all costs. I have never witnessed such poor teaching skills in my life. She has no idea how to explain concepts to students, and does not provide materials to help students accurately prepare for exams. Midterm questions did not focus on main concepts and were graded extremely tough.

Peng provided many materials and questions that allowed us to prepare for the exam. The recorded videos were extremely useful and also were the in-class questions. The exams were very straightforward, given you studied and understood all the practice questions, in-class questions and recorded videos and linked them to the slides.

Professor Zhang is amazing! She is very friendly and nice. Her lectures are clear and straightforward. Her exams are super easy and fair because everything is from her lectures and homework assignments. She is very approachable and organized. I also really liked the TAs that we had this term. They were super nice!

Peng is a very kind prof. Her 30% midterm was very fair as it exactly mirrored the practice questions given to us as well as the topics emphasized during lecture. Participation  easy 20% but final was ROUGH: 50% and a majority of it was the hardest version of every question practiced as well as stuff Id never seen be4. Got a B+ but worked SO HARD

Peng really took the time to make sure we understand the concepts and provided us with practice questions that were really helpful for exam preparations. There was a concern about academic integrity against me, but Peng gave me a chance to explain and was very understanding and forgiving in the end. She truly is a kind person and a competent prof

Her exams are misleading, filled with poor English and have confusing instructions. She doesn't take her time to show steps for the math. All material is her videos, very hard to understand and 0 textbook supplementing. Final exam had things I hadn't seen before. Very little practice opportunities. She's incapable of teaching IMO. AVOID.

Peng zhang gives student very good notes and lecture vedio. She assign 20% grade on participation so it's important to participate class but this 20% is easy to get. She also likes to answer students question and give a very useful feedback!

No point in lectures. She will record the content and post it to watch on our own. No incentive- the only time you're tested is in the midterm/final. Not enough practice questions for the exam. Vague midterm review policy. Listen to what comes out of her mouth, the recordings, and the slides. This course is hard! She is a kind, nice person tho.
she teaches so well

She has quizzes which random students take every week which makes missing lectures risky. Her tests were super hard and I didn't like her lectures. Unfortunately, BUS 207 seems to have no good options for profs.

She's good at teaching, but it is a hard course with difficult material. Re listen to the lecture recordings and you will do fine. Make sure you don't just memorize the lecture slides, but focus on what actually comes out of her mouth. Before going into the final I was at 95%, now I am unsure where I stand after a confusing and rushed final exam.

I would give a ZERO or NEGATIVE if I could. Not a very good teacher, as during coronavirus pandemic she made the final exam extremely difficult and not enough time to complete. Very unfair exam and did not care about students who had technical difficulties submitting exams. As if people don't have enough problems already, she makes things worse.

Honestly, one of the most difficult class to wrap your head around. Resources given were both lacking, and difficult to understand. The topics she discusses in class were poorly taught and polished at it seemed like she was teaching an unfinished class. Additionally, the textbook used is written by SFU staff and was the most garbage textbook toread

I am really confused by this professor. She teaches us limited topics that the textbook covers very briefly and expects us to know key points without pointing it out. Additionally the amount of resources she provides us with such as practice homework is almost inapplicable to what she actually teaches which leaves you clueless on how to study.

She is one of the worst profs I have taken class with. She didn't explain the concepts well. I have learnt better with youtube. On the bright side her midterm was similar to the weekly practice questions. Also the textbook is not required for the course. Best of luck if you happen choose her.

Tbh she is a good prof. Since English is her second language she explains with limited vocabs but still it is not that as difficult to understand. If you study all the materials and listen her recordings again you will probs get a good grade:) her final wasnt that hard

Peng is an alright professor for this course. She isn't the best at teaching, so you'll have to self-learn some of the trickier material. Focuses more on theory, so she is a better choice if you're not as strong in calculus (barely any calculus anyways). Probably easier than other professors, though the material and her lectures are hard to digest.
She is bad. Not a mean prof but she is just not good at teaching.

She is not a good prof at all. Her lectures are long and dry and she is unable to explain the concepts properly. She had two pop quizzes in the class for the whole semester. So you have to sit through the 3 hour lecture because you don't know when she would give the quiz. Two quizzes in class worth 20%. would not recommend.

I disagree with a lot of these ratings and think that some students blame peng for their poor understanding of math and/or micro. The final was identical to the homework, her lectures were informative and all the stuff she went over in class ended up on the final. She just got her PhD so she's new and learning to teach, but she good
Course is hard and lectures are confusing. she doesnt give a good job explaining them either so try taking it with other prof

Honestly, the course itself will be challenging for those who find Econ uninteresting. But her slides (quite wordy) are fine for you to work on your own. Come to her office hours more because I find she is very helpful in explaining to students. Overall remember to review all the chapters before finals because the finals is very long but not hard

She is horrible! Cant explain lecture materials well and bad pronunciation. She makes 2 pop quizzes each worth 10% to make sure people come to her lecture. The marking is unfair. Even if your answer make sense, you will still be deducted if you dont have their answer key answer. Gives you practice on formulas but test you on word problems.

can't explain her lectures and uses examples that are completely non-relevant with the topic. doesn't help the fact that her slides are awful too so u can't study it by yourself. take it with other profs
Not as terrible as comments said. She is helpful and patient. Lecture itself is a little bit hard. Need to do practice questions after class.
Absolutely horrible. Her lectures are so unorganized and doesn't know how to explain important concepts. Save yourself by taking this course with other profs.
She speaks English so bad. I can't understand her accent. She is baddddd.

Don't take this course with this professor. I understand that bus 207 by itself is already a difficult course but taking it with her makes it even worse. Her explanation makes you more confused than before attending her lecture and the only reason she has pop quizzes is because she knows students won't show up to her awful lectures without them
The course is hard. You have to study hard, doesn't matter which professor. Professor Zhang is an alright choice. Make sure to attend the lecture for pop-quiz and do exercise!

Lectures aren't necessarily that important, but you should at least attend the beginning of them in case of pop quiz. Read over the notes and go to the TA's office hours every week for help in thoroughly understanding the practice questions. Don't expect the exam to be like the practice. Overall her exams aren't that hard, but she can't teach.

Professor Zhang is an alright professor in my opinion. She made some really big mistakes when it came to explaining concepts. By this I mean, she explained the concept wrong and students had to correct her. The quizzes and midterm were extremely fair, but the FINAL was so UNFAIR, she nitpicked concepts we didn't practice on
Good.
I had struggles to understand her English

Pop quizzes are easy but extremely difficult final exam, lectures are boring and heavy as well. She explains concepts well as long as you listen to her recoding after class but I was lost for the most time during the lecture. You have to put lots of EXTRA EFFORTS in order to get a good grade. Avoid her if possible, not recommend

Sometimes difficult to understand, due to her accent and downright horrible penmanship. She goes through the in-class examples pretty quickly. Her quizzes were easy, but the final was completely random and difficult.

Peng is a very new instructor, so its not surprising that her first time teaching was not perfect. However, as long as you are familiar with the theory she teaches and do the weekly problems, you can probably get a good grade. The only reason why I got a B+ is because I didnt know how to prepare for the final that was worth 50%.
Easy quizzes and midterm, insanely difficult final exam with no relevance to her practice final.
Midterm and weekly quiz is fine but the final was so different from the weekly example although she said it gonna be similar

literally do not understand her as she has a thick accent. you must come to class as there are random tests which is annoying because I had to teach myself anyways because I couldn't understand but still had to show up as the tests were worth 20% of our grade. exams aren't very math heavy but more on the theoretical side.
